message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper deals with the problem of automatically detecting toxic text content on Twitter using machine learning techniques. The paper focuses on natural language processing and classification, which are key areas of research in the computer science sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). The use of n-grams and TFIDF normalization methods are common techniques in text classification, which are also relevant to the sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also involves the use of machine learning models, which are relevant to the sub-categories of Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of online toxicity, which is a social issue that can be studied from the perspective of the sub-category of Cybersecurity (cs.CY).
